reviews.sentence: Superb. The room was very spacious comfortable. There were no outside noises that carried into the room. It felt very private was very clean and staff were friendly. Also ask about parking I was given a pass to a car park lot that made the 66 for 24hour parking only 10 so very much worth your while to ask reception about this.

perfect location. Staff were so nice and helpful. Breakfast in the morning was perfect way to start the day. The location was by far the best central and close to Flinders street station and the Melbourne loop free trams. We ordered room service and our plates were left in the hall until after 3 pm the next day. We also stayed 3 days and only had one pack of kitchen detergent for the whole stay. Also asked for 2 double beds and got 1 double and 2 single without notice.

Great location accommodation and meals. Fantastic room service especially the beautiful fillet steak meal cooked just the way we ordered these. Breakfasts also great and friendly staff. Always check both bins possibly my fault since I said only towels needed replacement.

In the centre of where we wanted to stay Close to the Casino SouthBank Eureka Towers but also not far from the Bourke st cafes. Wanted a couch to sit on and put the feet up. The bed was comfortable. Lifts came quickly. Lovely breakfast Casino South Bank South Whart Eureka Tower Poly Wodside. Aquarium Very hard to adjust the shower hot and cold. The couch was a bit uncomfortable.

Good value and convenient. Good value clean and convenient to CBD. Heat can not be adjusted above 20 degrees which was an ok temperature. But if you want it warmer no joy. Halogen light in bathroom was flickering on and off and was annoying so just left it off. I would stay there again but it is booked out. Good value comfortable convenient location. Allow temperature control above 20 degrees. Staff check light bulbs if working or not.
Perfect Melvourne city stay. Excellent value all the services you need. Nice small pool and gym. Close to everything. Would definitely stay again.

Fun stay at oaks. Welcoming and comfortable stay all staff approachable and friendly. Bar was cosy and good prices wished I realised earlier. The booking was for 2 singles and at check in reception confirmed this but room made as double. Staff was very quick to fix. Also I thought not enough towels in room only 2 for a non service room. Again staff were very acomadting to fix. A much pleasurable stay at oaks.

Location location location. Enjoyed hotel except for the all day night roof top party on building next door. does not Melbourne have any anti noise by laws. Location. Tram to cruise ship dock stops outside the hotel. Great Mexican restaurant across the street. The really bad bathroom design. Door location. Narrow vanity counter. Multiple faucets and huge waste of water with shower at opposite end.

Great spot to explore Melbourne. The location of this hotel is brilliant. Right near two tram stops and the free tram service in the CBD is brilliant. Close to Crown complex and the Yara River. Great room on the 21st floor. Large spacious room. Front desk was great when we arrived at 070. They were able to get us in by 12 pm. Near to Degraves St for breakfast. Great cafes. The bathroom needs a bit of TLC. Leaky shower head needs attention but did nt bother us. Not a lot to dislike.
Good. Swimming pool location. Kitchen utensils were lacking.
Good. Nice sized romthe pool was too cool and particularly the spa I was so looking forward to a good soak in the spa but was not warm enough to stay in long.
Good location great staff. Very good bar really need go no further excellent cocktails. Staff very helpful full marks. There is a good breakfast joint up around the corner if on a no meal package.
Just a normal business hotel for business trip tour group.
Great location clean comfortable. Bed very comfortable. Information about how the discounted parking worked.

Though excellent location rooms are not great. The room had outdated appliances and bathroom fittings need to be updated. Ligting inside the room is very poor. There is no proper parking area to take the luggage from car and the luggage has to be carried by through steps there are no ramps or lifts to the lobby. The location is great. Close to all the important places and can be easily reached by walking or by tram.

Enjoyable stay at oaks. Comfy basic room nothing to complain about. Fairly close to the cbd with everything within walking distance or a tram ride away. Lost my room key and the guy at the desk hooked me up with a new one for no charge so that was great. Shower was pretty awful struggled to find the right temp as the taps were either too sensitive or not sensitive enough one of the two. Pretty minor hinderance but still annoying.

Good location to stay in Melbourne CBD. Hotel location is near the tram stops. Within walking distance. Can even walk to Bourke Street where all the shopping is happening. Near Flinders Train station and some good restaurants. Hotel staff were really friendly. Nice pool but the water is a little too cold for me to swim. Got to use the Jacuzi. Location friendly staff spacious room Near tram stops which could virtually get you anywhere in the CBD area. Near to some nice restaurants. Should provide extra pillow for guest and more hangers in the wardrobe.

Close to the convention centre and the city. Excellent obliging staff. I stayed for a week for a conference and will return again. Large apartment bed king size and pillows very good. The large sliding door that closes to separate the bedroom from the other areas of the apartment is part glass and hence may not be particularly soundproof. it is position. Well priced lunch and dinner menus. Happy hour daily. Close to Southern Cross and Flinders Street railway stations tram 75 m from door. 4 tram stops from Casino Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre With a 7 night stay the one bedroom apartment could have been improved with a dishwasher and a laundry. Some rooms are noisy due to elevators.

Not bad. It was value for money very spacious room studio that I stayed in. Complimentary late check out was nice even though I checked out even later paid for of courseBufet breakfast was pretty average. For some reason i thought it was included in the room hire but I was slapped with 25 for it. 25 can buy the best breakfast in town. Too stiff.

Nice close to everything we needed. Quite clean and fairly close to everything we needed. Stored our luggage for the day after we checked out. The towel rack in the bathroom kept falling off the wall. The staff were fine but nothing outstanding. did not ask how our stay was or anything so I did not get to tell him about the towel rack.
Great position in CBD but a noisy night. Very noisy room due to a party outside. I should have been informed or moved to another room.

Please Read. After booking online 2 rooms one week later 1250 cheaper one room was not ready on check In one hour late ac did n’t work fan and lights did n’t work in bath room I asked for a upgrade and to be fixed both fell on deaf ears it was very poor from you guys after I have stayed there 3 years in a row and sometimes twice a year.

We stayed here thinking we were getting a good deal with views of the Yara. that is what they told us we we are paying extra for. Not exactly as you can see by the picture. Room was tidy but bathroom was outdated with shower over bath. The bed was not very good. It was two singles together to make a king double. The devide was so prominent that we might as well have had two single beds. Location was easy. Value for money was not really that good. An extra 100 in Melbourne gets so much more. Probably would not stay again.

Never stay here. I have never experienced anything as bad as this hotel. The only thing this hotel had going for it was that the staff were friendly and polite and they had a good gym and indoor pool. On check in the toilet did not flush they sent the maintenance man up 45 mins later which meant we could not unpack as we did not know if we had to change rooms. The maintenance man was rude and could not fix the toilet. we had to go to reception and ask to be moved. The new room still had mans face shavings in the bathroom had no coat hangers no bathmat and the TV did not work. It took them 3 hours and many calls to reception to get these issues fixed. They offered me a late checkout the next day although I was not checking out for another 2 days. I spoke with reception to make sure that they were not going to check me out on the Saturday morning and they assured me that everything was fine and they would not check me out. At aprox. 130am I tried to re enter my room and I could not get in. I went back to reception and they had in fact checked me out. On the Sunday I was out until 2 pm and the room had not been made up I had to phone house keeping to get this done and when they did it linen was missing so I had to phone and again and get this delivered. After checkout they overcharged me and took money out of my account without permission. The general manager of Oaks has refunded the money but it was 3 days of hell. Also the beds are like rocks.

Room deposits. Was annoyed that they took a 75 deposit per room. Most place keep credit card details just in case for the booking they do n’t actually take the cash out unles there was a spend or other issues. We had 3 rooms which they took the deposit from which left our accounts but they tell us will take at least 3 working days to receive back. Not standard practice.

Enjoyable stay. Friendly counter staff. Be careful which side of the building you are on as one side faces a construction site and can be quite noisy. Bed was comfy and room was clean. The house keeping even did my dishes for me.

it is a great hotel and I love staying there. The people are lovely. No matter how long since my previous stay the restaurant manager always recognises and greets me. The hotel facilities are great. The rooms are quiet and spacious and the beds are always comfortable. The swimming pool and spa are good and a nice way to end the day. The breakfast is a bit of a let down. there is plenty of variety but the cooked food is just average. It does not represent value for money. If I am traveling for work I eat breakfast at the hotel because work picks up the bill. If I am traveling for a holiday I spend my money elsewhere.

This is a great hotel with all the amenities that you need for an enjoyable stay. it is quite central walking distance for a lot of the activities that we did. Also far enough not to hear city life actually very quiet. Staff were friendly.

Fair. Staff were friendly except one who clearly did nt want to be there. Plates too big for sink to wash. stored way too high. coffee cups were tiny. son found used condom under bed when we split them apart. fridge freezer needs defrosting and free wifi is not free have to pay after 30 mins plus what s with the tiny TV. wouldnt recommend Had a meal in restraunt not value for money lamb shank was below adverage.

2 weeks stay in December. Room and bathroom are decent quality bed is good. Shower can be a little cumbersome to adjust but once figured out it is comfortable. Bar is very good with pretty good service and food available at late hours. Reception personnel are friendly. The ladies at the breakfast area are extremely nice and make great coffee.
